importantArticles.headline: MIAMI, April 10, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. (NYSE: NCLH) (together with NCL Corporation Ltd., “Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings” or the “Company”) announced today it will report first quarter 2025 financial results on Wednesday, April 30, 2025 at 6:30 a.m. Eastern Time with a conference call and webcast to discuss results at 8:00 a.m. Eastern Time. The conference call will be webcast via the Company’s Investor Relations website, https://www.nclhltd.com/investors.
importantArticles.title: Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings to Hold Conference Call on First Quarter 2025 Financial Results

importantArticles.headline: Investing.com -- Morgan Stanley flagged the weakest U.S. cruise demand in three years following fresh channel checks, prompting earnings and price target cuts across the sector. The brokerage Carnival (NYSE:CCL) Corp upgrade to "Equal-weight," but the analysts maintained a cautious tone about the sector while expressing a preference for Royal Caribbean (NYSE:RCL) amid rising macroeconomic uncertainty.
importantArticles.title: MS upgrades Carnival, prefers Royal Caribbean amid recession risks, demand drop

importantArticles.headline: Charters contribute to Company’s fleet optimization efforts under its Charting the Course strategyMIAMI, April 07, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. (NYSE: NCLH) today announced the execution of long-term charter agreements, each inclusive of purchase options, for four vessels across its three brands. The agreements are for: Two Norwegian Cruise Line vessels, Norwegian Sky and Norwegian Sun, to be chartered to Cordelia Cruises, a premium cruise operator based in India.
importantArticles.title: Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Announces Charter Agreements for Four Vessels
